intro: Aegiphila racemosa, commonly known as the clustered aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in the summer months. The plant is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
